posts.post_content: A nicely balanced card. A one-for-one that gains you the advantage if you play well (choose the right creature to take out, at the right time). It's not an instant, but can take almost any creature (eg. it doesn't specify non-black)... Vigilance lends a nice little Black vs White tension to it. And I don't feel bad losing a 5 or 6 mana creature to a 3 mana spell (whereas it is really depressing when you finally hit 6 mana and drop your beautiful dragon just to have the opponent off it for 1 or 2 mana).
posts.html:
A nicely balanced card. A one-for-one that gains you the advantage if you play well (choose the right creature to take out, at the right time). It's not an instant, but can take almost any creature (eg. it doesn't specify non-black)... Vigilance lends a nice little Black vs White tension to it. And I don't feel bad losing a 5 or 6 mana creature to a 3 mana spell (whereas it is really depressing when you finally hit 6 mana and drop your beautiful dragon just to have the opponent off it for 1 or 2 mana).
Report Abuse  
Posted By: beyond_malachi (12/23/2009 8:43:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Though this is a nice sorcery, and something good you can pull on your opponents, I find that having a Royal Assassin or two out on the field is ever more powerful. They're the same converted cost, but Royal Assassins are reusable and their effects are "instants," so you can take out attackers immediately after they're declared.
posts.html:
Though this is a nice sorcery, and something good you can pull on your opponents, I find that having a Royal Assassin or two out on the field is ever more powerful. They're the same converted cost, but Royal Assassins are reusable and their effects are "instants," so you can take out attackers immediately after they're declared.

posts.post_content: Pretty mediocre removal spell. Better options in literally every constructed format, but it's at least decent in limited. My friends came up with an analogy comparing this to [Royal Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Royal Assassin): Assassinate is how amateurs do it, and Royal Assassin is how a professional does it.
posts.html:
Pretty mediocre removal spell. Better options in literally every constructed format, but it's at least decent in limited. My friends came up with an analogy comparing this to Royal Assassin: Assassinate is how amateurs do it, and Royal Assassin is how a professional does it.
